titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alfredo de Palchi and Sona Raiziss papers
de Palchi (Alfredo) and Sona Raiziss papers
titlestmt.author: by Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday January 26, 2019 at 04:00

did.unittitle: Alfredo de Palchi and Sona Raiziss papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Alfredo de Palchi and Sona Raiziss Papers contain correspondence between de Palchi and Raiziss and with others, concerning their writings, the literary journal Chelsea, and literary prizes; poems, other writings, and English translations of Italian poetry by de Palchi and Raiziss; writings by others, mostly Italian poetry translated into English by Raiziss and de Palchi, published by them in Chelsea, or submitted for literary prizes sponsored by them; clippings and other printed material relating to writings of de Palchi and Raiziss, and to other poets; biographical information about Raiziss and scrapbooks of ephemera relating to her early life and education at the University of Pennsylvania and Cornell University, 1920s; a few audiocassettes and videocassettes relating to poets and poetry readings; and a small amount of photographs and drawings. Research strengths include poetry by de Palchi and Raiziss; translation of Italian poetry into English by them and others; their editorship of Chelsea; other 20th-century Italian poets and their translators; the Academy of American Poets and the Raiziss/de Palchi Fellowship; and the Bordighera Poetry Prize.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 47 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 48 (reel-to-reel tape): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 49 (audiovisual materials): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Alfredo de Palchi and Sona Raiziss papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alfredo de Palchi and Sona Raiziss Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection consists of materials formerly classed as Uncat MS Vault 791, Uncat MS Vault 820, Uncat MS Vault 857, Uncat MSS 132, Uncat MSS 185, Uncat MSS 498, Uncat MSS 579, Uncat MSS 784, and Uncat MSS 861. In 2013, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including partial rehousing and minimal organization. The collection was reclassed under one call number, materials were organized into series, and containers were renumbered in a single sequence. Most folder titles were based on information provided by the donor, while some were assigned by Library staff. Most names in the Correspondence and Writings of Others series were updated to conform to Library of Congress name authorities. Folder titles were not verified against contents.

bioghist.head: Alfredo de Palchi (1926-)
bioghist.p: Italian poet and translator. De Palchi was born in Italy and emigrated to the United States, settling in New York City in 1956. In 1952 he married poet and translator Sona Raiziss, with whom he edited the the literary journal Chelsea , 1966-1994. After Raiziss's death in 1994, de Palchi edited Chelsea , 1994-2007, and has continued to manage the Sonia Raiziss Giop Charitable Foundation. He married Rita di Pace in 1989. Chelsea Editions, a subdivision of Chelsea Associates, edited by de Palchi, publishes bilingual editions of literature, mostly contemporary Italian poetry with English translation.

bioghist.head: Sona Raiziss (1909-1994)
bioghist.p: American poet and translator, also spelled Sonia Raiziss. Raiziss was born in Germany, was raised in Philadelphia, and attended the University of Pennsylvania, Cornell University, and Columbia University. Her translations include poetry of Alfredo de Palchi, whom she married in 1952. With de Palchi, she edited the literary journal Chelsea , 1966-1994. Raiziss founded the Sonia Raiziss Giop Charitable Foundation, which continues to fund the Jane Austen Essay Contest, the Bordighera Poetry Prize, and the Raiziss/de Palchi Translation Awards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Alfredo de Palchi and Sona Raiziss Papers contain correspondence between de Palchi and Raiziss and with others, concerning their writings, the literary journal Chelsea , and literary prizes; poems, other writings, and English translations of Italian poetry by de Palchi and Raiziss; writings by others, mostly Italian poetry translated into English by Raiziss and de Palchi, published by them in Chelsea , or submitted for literary prizes sponsored by them; clippings and other printed material relating to writings of de Palchi and Raiziss, and to other poets; biographical information about Raiziss and scrapbooks of ephemera relating to her early life and education at the University of Pennsylvania and Cornell University, 1920s; a few audiocassettes and videocassettes relating to poets and poetry readings; and a small amount of photographs and drawings. Research strengths include poetry by de Palchi and Raiziss; translation of Italian poetry into English by them and others; their editorship of Chelsea ; other 20th-century Italian poets and their translators; the Academy of American Poets and the Raiziss/de Palchi Fellowship; and the Bordighera Poetry Prize.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Correspondence, 1961-2005. II. Writings, 1930s-1999. III. Writings by Others, 1939-2003. IV. Printed Material, 1930s-1950s. V. Other Papers, 1920s-1930s.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Audiocassettes in boxes 22, 37, and 38: Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Videocassettes in box 36: Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Additional correspondence is in Series II, Writings, and Series III, Writings of Others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Sona Raiziss; and Alfredo de Palchi. Each subseries is arranged alphabetically by correspondent, followed by unsorted correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence includes letters concerning writings of de Palchi and Raiziss, literary prizes managed by them, writings of others, and Chelsea . Some letters enclose drafts of writings or photographs. Unsorted correspondence may include additional letters from correspondents who are individually listed.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Sona Raiziss and Alfredo de Palchi; Sona Raiziss; and Alfredo de Palchi. Each subseries is arranged alphabetically by work title or genre, followed by unsorted writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes drafts of poetry, poetry collections, and other writings by de Palchi and Raiziss, some with related correspondence. Raiziss's writings include translations of poetry by de Palchi. The Writings by Sona Raiziss and Alfredo De Palchi subseries consists mostly of English translations of Italian poetry of other writers, some with related biographical information and correspondence. Some of these writers are also represented in Series III, Writings of Others.

did.unittitle: Sona Raiziss and Alfredo de Palchi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes poetry of Arnaldo di Benedetto, Vincenzo Cardarelli, Bartolo Cattafi, Eugenio Montale, Mario Novaro, Lucio Piccolo, Leonardo Sinisgalli, David Turoldo, Giuseppe Ungaretti, and others

did.unittitle: Other poetry translations by Sona Raiziss and others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes translations of: Dino Campana, Giorgio Caproni, Vincenzo Cardarelli, Bartolo Cattafi, Luciano Erba, Alfonso Gatto, Eugenio Montale, Giorgio Orelli, Cesare Pavese, Lucio Piccolo, Salvatore Quasimodo, Umberto Saba, Rocco Scotellaro, Vittorio Sereni, Leonardo Sinisgalli, David Turoldo, and Giuseppe Ungaretti

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains writings by and about authors, translators, and visual artists, some with related correspondence. Some writings of others relate to Chelsea or to translations by Raiziss or de Palchi; additional translations may be found in Series II, Writings.
